rulings.title: Shafi'i Madhhab - Steps of Wudu
items: Make intention (niyyah) for wudu
Say 'Bismillah' before beginning
Wash hands up to the wrists three times
Rinse mouth (madmadah) three times
Sniff water into nose and expel (istinshaq) three times
Wash face from hairline to chin and ear to ear three times
Wash both arms up to and including elbows three times
Wipe over the head (masah) once, including ears
Wash both feet up to and including ankles three times
Maintain the prescribed sequence (tartib) and continuity (muwalat)

rulings.title: Hanafi Madhhab - Steps of Wudu
items: Make intention (niyyah) for wudu
Say 'Bismillah' (recommended)
Wash both hands up to the wrists three times (sunnah)
Rinse mouth three times (sunnah)
Sniff water into nose and expel three times (sunnah)
Wash entire face three times (obligatory once)
Wash arms including elbows three times (obligatory once)
Wipe one-fourth of the head once (obligatory)
Wipe ears (sunnah)
Wash both feet including ankles three times (obligatory once)
Follow sequence is not obligatory but preferred

rulings.title: Nullifiers of Wudu (All Madhhabs)
rulings.notes: These actions break wudu and require renewal before the next prayer.
items: Anything that exits from the private parts (e.g., urine, feces, gas)
Loss of consciousness (e.g., deep sleep, fainting)
Touching private parts directly (varies by madhhab)
Vomiting a mouthful (disagreed upon, obligatory to renew in some madhhabs)
Bleeding (breaks wudu in Hanafi, not necessarily in others)

rulings.title: Daily Fard Prayers
rulings.notes: These are the five obligatory prayers in Islam.
items: Fajr – 2 rak'ahs (before sunrise)
Dhuhr – 4 rak'ahs (after noon)
Asr – 4 rak'ahs (mid-afternoon)
Maghrib – 3 rak'ahs (just after sunset)
Isha – 4 rak'ahs (nightfall)
